location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Farish, Secretary to the Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter from James Farish, Secretary to the Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, requiring fifty candies of sulphur of the best quality from the Persian Gulf, for manufacturing gunpowder.In attachment, letter sent on 6 December 1814 from William Newnham, Secretary to the Military Board at Bombay Castle to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, enclosing a copy of the letter received on 5 December from the Agent for the Manufacture of Gun Powder with the Board's recommendations that the Resident at Bushire may consign the sulphur required.
